com.soa.message.handler
Interface MessageContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultMessageContext
public interface MessageContext

The context of a message passed through the messaging engine. The context is given to message handlers. The context consists of the current message and optional parameters that can be read and altered by message handlers.

Since:
3.1

Method Detail

getProperty

java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
Returns the property with the given name.

Parameters:
name - Name of the property.
Returns:
Object holding the value of the requested property, null if none found.

setProperty

void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object property)
Adds or replaces a property.

Parameters:
name - Name of the property.
property - Value of the property.

getPropertyNames

java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
Returns the names of the properties associated with the context. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the context, so if a name is removed from the Set, the property is removed from the context. Names cannot be added however.

Returns:
Set of String property names.

getMessage

Message getMessage()
Returns the message.

Returns:
Message object.

setMessage

void setMessage(Message msg)
Changes the message in the context.

Parameters:
msg - Message part of the context.

getExchange

Exchange getExchange()
Returns the exchange the message is part of.

Returns:
ExchangeContext holding information about the exchange.

getParameterType

ParameterType getParameterType()
Returns the type of message.

Returns:
ParameterType of the message.

getMessageName

java.lang.String getMessageName()
Returns the name of the message as defined in WSDL. This is an optional property. If the parameter type is IN or OUT, then no message name is required. If the parameter type is FAULT, then a message name is recommended if there are more than one fault defined for the given operation.

Returns:
Name of the message, null if not specified.

isMessageReadOnly

boolean isMessageReadOnly()
Returns whether the message in the context is read-only or can be modified. Handlers must not alter a message when read-only.

Returns:
True if read-only, false if not.

getAuditLogger

ContextLogger getAuditLogger()
Provides audit logging capabilities. This is different than the system logging capabilities provided by Logger. The audit log statements are governed by and viewed in the management application. Each log statement has a different level of importance or purpose, debug, warning, or error in that order. These statements will only be seen in the log if the handler is invoked with a level equal to or greater than that statement.

Returns:
ContextLogger.
